intro: Primulina cordata, commonly known as the velvet leaf. It is a species of flowering plant in the Gesneriaceae family, native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are typically dark green with a velvety texture. It produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink or white, often blooming during the warmer months. Primulina cordata is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
